description: These easy, cheesy vegan quesadillas are stuffed with a zippy homemade cashew cheese, hearty pinto beans, and a spicy mixture of poblano peppers and red onions.
name: Poblano Pepper & Pinto Bean Cheesy Vegan Quesadillas
recipeIngredient: 1 cup unflavored soy or almond milk
1 cup raw cashews, (soaked in water 4-8 hours, drained and rinsed)
2 tablespoons Cholula hot sauce (or a similar vinegar-based hot sauce)
1 poblano pepper, (seeded and cut into strips)
1 cup cooked or canned pinto beans, (drained)
1 tablespoon Cholula hot sauce (or a similar vinegar-based hot sauce)
Oil or cooking spray, ( for grilling)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients into the bowl of a food processor and blend until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.

Transfer the mixture to a small saucepan and place over medium heat. Heat the mixture while whisking constantly, until it becomes thick and stretchy and pulls away from the sides of the pan, about 4-5 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and allow it to cool for a few minutes while you prepare the other ingredients.
